candidates.title: Introduce buffer SubRange
candidates.body:
Fixes #3166 

Having `Range<Option<X>>` was not very good, since it doesn't make sense for the offset to be optional (instead, it's obvious `0` can be used).

The PR also merges the `XxxTexelBuffer` descriptors, since having them different didn't make sense in the world where descriptor types are different (i.e. all the difference is in the type, not in the descriptor itself).

PR checklist:
- [x] `make` succeeds (on *nix)
- [x] `make reftests` succeeds
- [ ] tested examples with the following backends:
- [ ] `rustfmt` run on changed code

candidates.title: [dx11] new binding model
candidates.body:
Sibling of #3122 on master

This change *really* shines on master, because the `DescriptorType` enum is now more complex, and all the matching is concentrated in one single place instead of being spread thin over the code.

candidates.title: [0.4/dx11] New binding model
candidates.body:
Does most of the work for #3121 . Unfortunately, it *still* doesn't fix it, because SPIRV-Cross on HLSL lacks resource mapping overrides. So we are blocked on https://github.com/KhronosGroup/SPIRV-Cross/issues/1252 , but we can follow-up with a fix here once it's available, the fix is going to be small.

Status:
- [x] types and general structure
- [x] descriptor pool
- [x] binding descriptors
- [x] pipeline layout
- [x] shader decorations

Tested on wgpu-rs examples :tada: .

Compromises:
  - descriptor binding code responsible for coherent memory is removed, since it's tricky and we disabled coherent memory in #3120
  - copying descriptor sets is not implemented for now

Reopening #3037 against `master`, for merge whenever ready.

Note that compiling examples currently doesn't work because `winit` still imports the old version of `raw-window-handle`; the two versions of the traits are incompatible.

PR checklist:

- [x] `make reftests` succeeds
- [x] tested examples with the following backends: `vulkan`
- [x] `rustfmt` run on changed code

candidates.title: gl: Fix quad example on native and web
candidates.body:
Fixes #3023
Fixes #3036 

PR checklist:
- [ ] `make` succeeds (on *nix)
- [ ] `make reftests` succeeds
- [X] tested examples with the following backends: gl
- [ ] `rustfmt` run on changed code

Summary:
- Remove the coherent requirement and instead flush mapped memory ranges for the quad example.
  - Currently [we purposely do not provide `COHERENT` when buffer storage isn't available](https://github.com/gfx-rs/gfx/blob/da078cd6e4cc49f542310ce7a0ff12ba0a07b13a/src/backend/gl/src/lib.rs#L452) on native OpenGL (I guess we can decide later whether that's necessary or if this can be emulated). Regardless I think we need the flush for WebGL to work here.
  - Another option for the quad example is to fallback when coherent memory isn't available. I didn't do that for now because I thought it would complicate the quad example more.
- Avoid checking `MAX_TEXTURE_BUFFER_SIZE` and `SHADER_STORAGE_BUFFER_OFFSET_ALIGNMENT` on WebGL because they're not available. Later we can think of a better way to expose this restriction from glow, maybe providing the limits as `Option`s.
  - I don't think these were actually breaking anything, but they did log warnings in the console.
- The version bumps probably aren't necessary, but I did it anyway while debugging because I hit an issue with an older version of wasm-bindgen.

![Screen Shot 2019-10-10 at 10 18 49 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2113872/66617059-f8599200-ebad-11e9-8a34-4b2f5c0f5c71.png)

candidates.title: dx12: Implement dynamic uniform buffers
candidates.body:
Part of #1949

Implement dynamic uniform buffers via root descriptors (2 slots in the root signature per descriptor).
This approach is suitable for uniform buffers as these are translated to typed constant buffers on the shader side.

Storage buffers need to be implemented another way as we would oversubscribe the root signature and we need to deal with read-only descriptors in a way, which is not feasible with the root descriptor approach.

Tested with an modified quad example, executing two draw calls with a different offset.

TODO: d3d12-rs changes pending

candidates.title: [v0.18] Remove derivative usage & release
candidates.body:
Cherry-pick #3029 into `v0.18` as a non-breaking improvement to compile speed.

Bumped versions:
* gfx_core -> `0.9.2`
* gfx -> `0.18.2`

candidates.title: [pre-ll] Remove derivative
candidates.body:
* Remove crate derivative.
* Fix some warnings: `&Error` -> `&dyn Error`.

After reading about master branch speeding up compile times by removing _derivative_ I wondered if it would help the pre-ll code too. Tbf I can see derivative is quite helpful for the `PhantomData` types where regular `#[derive(...)]` falls down. But it isn't _that_ hard to write out the impls.

It impacts clean builds more than I would expect _(linux, rust 1.38, ryzen 2700x)_.

### Before
```sh
$ hyperfine --max-runs 3 'cargo clean; cargo build --example cube' 
Benchmark #1: cargo clean; cargo build --example cube
  Time (mean ± σ):     34.765 s ±  0.126 s    [User: 248.966 s, System: 12.062 s]
  Range (min … max):   34.666 s … 34.906 s    3 runs
```
### After
```sh
$ hyperfine --max-runs 3 'cargo clean; cargo build --example cube'
Benchmark #1: cargo clean; cargo build --example cube
  Time (mean ± σ):     28.158 s ±  0.343 s    [User: 250.888 s, System: 12.067 s]
  Range (min … max):   27.819 s … 28.504 s    3 runs
```

PR checklist:
- [x] tested examples with the following backends: gl

candidates.title: [0.3/dx12] rework resource state conversion, better external barriers
candidates.body:
Follow-up to #3010 that tries to address #3009 better. Replaces #3013
Edit: this combines parts 2 and 3 of the big dx12 barrier refactor :)

PR checklist:
- [ ] `make` succeeds (on *nix)
- [ ] `make reftests` succeeds
- [x] tested examples with the following backends: dx12
- [ ] `rustfmt` run on changed code

Contains 2 ideas:
  1. we try to extract more information out of the image layouts, which is more robust
  2. we are very selective in the external access dependencies, only taking ones that are related to where the attachment is used first or last.

candidates.title: Makes gl backend use parking_lot
candidates.body:
PR checklist:
- [ ] `make` succeeds (on *nix)
- [ ] `make reftests` succeeds
- [X] tested examples with the following backends: gl
- [ ] `rustfmt` run on changed code

`make` succeeds on Windows with DX11 disabled.
Please note that `parking_lot` types do not become poisoned, so a program behaviour may be different if a locking thread panics.

candidates.title: Reduces allocations on Vulkan create_*_pipeline(s), and fixes #2987
candidates.body:
Fixes #2987

PR checklist:
- [ ] `make` succeeds (on *nix)
- [ ] `make reftests` succeeds
- [X] tested examples with the following backends: Windows Vulkan + GL + DX12
- [ ] ~`rustfmt` run on changed code~

`make` succeeds on Windows, and `make reftests` fails even on master, didn't try building on Linux.

This greatly reduces the amount of Vecs used on the Vulkan create_*_pipeline(s) by combining vectors.
